definitions.definition: A light sword, sharp along the front edge, part of the back edge, and at the point.
A modern fencing sword modeled after the sabre.
To strike or kill with a sabre.
A tilting match: a mock combat between two mounted knights or men-at-arms using lances in the lists or enclosed field.
To engage in mock combat on horseback, as two knights in the lists; to tilt.
To engage in verbal sparring over an important issue. (used of two people, both of whom participate more or less equally)
To touch penises while engaging in a sex act, especially oral sex.
A quick grab, bat, or other motion with the hand or paw; a sweep.
A strong blow given with a sweeping motion, as with a bat or club.
An act of interacting with a touch screen by drawing the finger rapidly across it.
An act of passing a swipecard through a card reader.
A rough guess; an estimate or swag.
definitions.example: Take a swipe at the answer, even if you're not sure.

definitions.definition: An attack, insult or critical remark.
definitions.example: The politician took a swipe at his opponents.

definitions.definition: Poor, weak beer or other inferior alcoholic beverage; rotgut.
To grab or bat quickly.
definitions.example: The cat swiped at the shoelace.

definitions.definition: To strike with a strong blow in a sweeping motion.
To scan or register by sliding (a swipecard etc.) through a reader.
definitions.example: He swiped his card at the door.

definitions.definition: To interact with a touch screen by drawing one's finger rapidly across it.
definitions.example: Swipe left to hide the toolbar.

definitions.definition: To draw (one's finger) rapidly across a touch screen.
To steal or snatch.
definitions.example: Hey! Who swiped my lunch?

definitions.definition: An impertinent individual.
Insolent, ill-mannered
Irrelevant (opposite of pertinent)
To make the first kick in a game or part of a game.
definitions.example: The players kick off for the third quarter and the clock starts.

definitions.definition: To start; to launch.
definitions.example: Let's kick off this project with a planning meeting.

definitions.definition: To dismiss; to expel; to remove from a position.
definitions.example: I got kicked off the team after a string of poor performances

definitions.definition: To die or quit permanently.
definitions.example: It's a wonder that old dog hasn't kicked off yet.

definitions.definition: To shut down or turn off suddenly.
definitions.example: The washer was working fine until it kicked off in the middle of a cycle.

definitions.definition: To suddenly become more active.
definitions.example: The party kicked off when the third bottle of wine was opened.

definitions.definition: (ranching) To force the weaning of a bovine cow's calf by restricting the calf's access to its mother's udders. Used figuratively or literally.
definitions.example: A week after we kicked off her calf that cow was still bawling.

definitions.definition: To be overcome with anger, to start an argument or a fight.
definitions.example: When she called him a drunk, it was the last straw. He just kicked off.

definitions.definition: To have a fight or argument start.
definitions.example: It really kicked off in town when the team lost.

definitions.definition: Sexual desire or oestrus of cattle, and various other mammals.
The noise made by deer during sexual excitement.
Roaring, as of waves breaking upon the shore; rote.
To be in the annual rut or mating season.
To have sexual intercourse.
To have sexual intercourse with.
A furrow, groove, or track worn in the ground, as from the passage of many wheels along a road.
A fixed routine, procedure, line of conduct, thought or feeling.
A dull routine.
definitions.example: Dull job, no interests, no dates. He's really in a rut.

definitions.definition: To make a furrow.
Rubeola, an acute highly contagious disease, often of childhood, caused by Measles virus, of genus Morbillivirus, featuring a spreading red skin rash, fever, runny nose, cough and red eyes
Any of several other similar diseases, such as German measles.
A disease of pigs and cattle, caused by larval tapeworms.
A disease of trees, in which the leaves are covered in spots.
A leper.
A tapeworm larva.
Any of many blends of spices used in Indian cuisine, most often containing cardamom, coriander, mace together with pepper, nutmeg, fennel seeds, jeera etc.
A flower of the genus Hibiscus, especially Hibiscus syriacus, found in tropical to temperate regions, of some species used for making infusions/tea.
A cocktail made with champagne and cranberry juice.
A running sport popular in US high schools, colleges, etc. where participants race over varying terrain (e.g. golf courses, roads, etc.) in approximately 5- to 10-kilometre races. Abbreviated XC.
A phase of the equestrian sport of three day eventing, which the horse and rider travel over varied terrain and jump natural obstacles.
Flight between two points or aerodromes using navigational techniques.
From one side of a country to the other.
Across countryside.
Relating to cross country racing.
(of data or research) Across countries.
A tooth which will be replaced as a child ages, as opposed to an adult permanent tooth; a milk tooth
Within this content, context, or thing.
A pedestrian crossing featuring broad white stripes painted parallel to the street.
A back issue of a magazine, etc.
Anything considered old-fashioned.
The stock of a family; a race or generation of progenitors.
A branch of a family.
An advanced or leading position; the lookout.
The above-ground stalk (technically axis) of a vascular plant, and certain anatomically similar, below-ground organs such as rhizomes, bulbs, tubers, and corms.
A slender supporting member of an individual part of a plant such as a flower or a leaf; also, by analogy, the shaft of a feather.
definitions.example: the stem of an apple or a cherry

definitions.definition: A narrow part on certain man-made objects, such as a wine glass, a tobacco pipe, a spoon.

The main part of an uninflected word to which affixes may be added to form inflections of the word. A stem often has a more fundamental root. Systematic conjugations and declensions derive from their stems.
A person's leg.
The penis.
A vertical stroke of a letter.
A vertical stroke marking the length of a note in written music.
A premixed portion of a track for use in audio mastering and remixing.
The vertical or nearly vertical forward extension of the keel, to which the forward ends of the planks or strakes are attached.
A component on a bicycle that connects the handlebars to the bicycle fork
A part of an anatomic structure considered without its possible branches or ramifications.
A crack pipe; or the long, hollow portion of a similar pipe (i.e. meth pipe) resembling a crack pipe.
(chiefly British) A winder on a clock, watch, or similar mechanism
To remove the stem from.
definitions.example: to stem cherries; to stem tobacco leaves

definitions.definition: To be caused or derived; to originate.
definitions.example: The current crisis stems from the short-sighted politics of the previous government.

definitions.definition: To descend in a family line.
To direct the stem (of a ship) against; to make headway against.
To hit with the stem of a ship; to ram.
To ram (clay, etc.) into a blasting hole.
To stop, hinder (for instance, a river or blood).
definitions.example: to stem a tide

definitions.definition: To move the feet apart and point the tips of the skis inward in order to slow down the speed or to facilitate a turn.
A gleam of light; a flame.
Acronym of science, technology, engineering, (and) mathematics.
An electron microscope that transmits a very narrow beam of electrons through a sample; it can detect individual large or heavy atoms.
Someone who designs clothing professionally.
A word or phrase in a language formed by word-for-word or morpheme-by-morpheme translation of a word in another language.
definitions.example: The word "watershed" is a calque of the German "Wasserscheide".

definitions.definition: Expressing disapproval or being critical of oneself, especially modestly or humorously so.
One who qualifies for something, especially a contestant who qualifies for a stage in a competition.
A preliminary stage of a competition.
(grammar) A word or phrase, such as an adjective or adverb, that describes or characterizes another word or phrase, such as a noun or verb; a modifier; that adds or subtracts attributes to another.
A marker that qualifies or modifies another code element.

One of a class of caustic bases, such as soda, soda ash, caustic soda, potash, ammonia, and lithia, whose distinguishing peculiarities are solubility in alcohol and water, uniting with oils and fats to form soap, neutralizing and forming salts with acids, turning to brown several vegetable yellows, and changing reddened litmus to blue.
(Western United States) Soluble mineral matter, other than common salt, contained in soils of natural waters.
A subatomic particle forming part of the nucleus of an atom and having no charge; it is a combination of an up quark and two down quarks.
A medical imaging technique in which an X-ray image is taken to visualize the inside of blood vessels and organs of the body, with particular interest in the arteries, veins and the heart chambers.
The annual period during which a student attends school, college or university.
definitions.example: In many countries the academic year starts in September and finishes in August of the next calendar year.

definitions.definition: A feeling of depression resulting from being alone or from having no companions.
The condition or state of being alone or having no companions.
The state of being unfrequented or devoid of human activity (of a place or time).
A desire to be alone; disposition to solitude.
An open-ended barrel used to contain rainwater; a rain barrel
The branch of biology that deals with the transmission and variation of inherited characteristics, in particular chromosomes and DNA.
The genetic makeup of a specific individual or species.
A baked food item made from flour and fat pastes such as pie crust; also tarts, bear claws, napoleons, puff pastries, etc.
definitions.example: That pastry shop sells not just pastries, but all kinds of baked goods.

definitions.definition: The food group formed by the various kinds of pastries.
definitions.example: That pastry shop sells not just pastry, but all kinds of baked goods.

definitions.definition: The type of light flour-based dough used in pastries.
A place where pastry is made.
The act or art of making pastry.
definitions.example: He learned pastry from the great Gaston Lenôtre.

definitions.definition: A major change in the use of something, or in the appearance of something or someone; a radical transformation.
definitions.example: This room is a mess; it needs a makeover.

definitions.definition: The basic military skills required to operate in the field, such as stealth, camouflage, and observation.
(UK politics) Someone who supports Brexit, the United Kingdom's exit from the European Union.
One who leaves.
definitions.example: He's a leaver, not a stayer: he'll never be happy tied down in one place.

definitions.definition: To take part in a charade, deception, or practical joke.
definitions.example: James played along with the frat boys.

definitions.definition: An adhesive bandage used in dressing wounds
An inadequate solution to a serious problem.
Any of several African birds of the family Numididae (6 species) resembling partridges.
The position of a head or chief.
The position of a headmaster or headmistress.
Authority or dignity.
A medicine that operates through the nose; an errhine.
A vowel or consonant (such as [m] or [n]) articulated with air flowing through the nose.
Part of a helmet projecting to protect the nose; a nose guard.
One of the nasal bones.
A plate, or scale, on the nose of a fish, etc.
Of or pertaining to the nose or to the nasion

Having a sound imparted by means of the nose; and specifically, made by lowering the soft palate, in some cases with closure of the oral passage, the voice thus issuing (wholly or partially) through the nose, as in the consonants m, n, ng; characterized by resonance in the nasal passage
definitions.example: a nasal utterance.

definitions.definition: A person who slavishly follows current fashion.
An expression referring to another expression. In stricter uses, an expression referring to something earlier in the discourse or, even more strictly, only reflexive and reciprocal pronouns.
The repetition of a phrase at the beginning of phrases, sentences, or verses, used for emphasis.
An expression that can refer to virtually any referent, the specific referent being defined by context.
An expression that refers to a preceding expression.
The most solemn part of the Divine Liturgy or the Mass during which the offerings of bread and wine are consecrated as body and blood of Christ
An agreement; a compact; a covenant.
An agreement between two or more nations
To form a pact; to agree formally.
The formation of thrombi in the blood vessels of a living organism, causing obstruction of the circulation.
Something that can be attained.
Able to be accomplished, achieved, or obtained.
In a pathetic manner; piteously.
A liquid used to clean one's mouth.
A common true thrush, Turdus merula, found in woods and gardens over much of Eurasia, and introduced elsewhere.
A variety of New World birds of the family Icteridae (26 species of icterid bird).
(among slavers and pirates) A native of the South Pacific islands.
To enslave someone, especially through chicanery or force
An edible plant (Brassica oleracea var. capitata) having a head of green leaves.
The leaves of this plant eaten as a vegetable.
definitions.example: Cabbage is good for you.

definitions.definition: A person with severely reduced mental capacities due to brain damage.
definitions.example: After the car crash, he became a cabbage.

definitions.definition: Used as a term of endearment.
Money.
Marijuana leaf, the part that is not smoked but from which cannabutter can be extracted.
The terminal bud of certain palm trees, used for food.
The cabbage palmetto (Sabal palmetto), a palm of the southeastern US coasts and nearby islands.
To form a head like that of the cabbage.
definitions.example: to make lettuce cabbage

definitions.definition: To do nothing; to idle; veg out.
Scraps of cloth which are left after a garment has been cut out, which tailors traditionally kept.
To purloin or embezzle; to pilfer, to steal.

A bill; a commercial document issued by a seller to a buyer indicating the products, quantities and agreed prices for products or services that the seller has already provided the buyer with. An invoice indicates that, unless paid in advance, payment is due by the buyer to the seller, according to the agreed terms.
The lot or set of goods as shipped or received.
definitions.example: The merchant receives a large invoice of goods.

definitions.definition: (generally of a vehicle) The price which a seller or dealer pays the manufacturer for goods to be sold.
To bill; to issue an invoice to.
definitions.example: I will invoice my supplier tomorrow.

definitions.definition: To make an invoice for (goods or services).
Appearance, especially the features and expression of the face.
Favour; support; encouragement.
Superficial appearance; show; pretense.
Calm facial expression, composure, self-control.
To tolerate, support, sanction, patronise or approve of something.
definitions.example: The cruel punishment was countenanced by the government, although it was not officially legal.

definitions.definition: A substitute batter; one who pinch-hits.
An aggressive batsman brought on to score runs quickly, even at the risk of losing his wicket.
An individual who substitutes for another to perform one or more tasks.
definitions.example: I'll be sending a pinch hitter to do the presentation because I have the flu.

definitions.definition: A product consisting of a liquid which has had other ingredients steeped in it to extract useful qualities.
definitions.example: An extract of rooibos and chamomile makes a refreshing infusion.

definitions.definition: The act of steeping or soaking a substance in liquid so as to extract medicinal or herbal qualities.
The act of installing a quality into a person.
The act of dipping into a fluid.
(medicine) The administration of liquid substances directly into a vein for medical purposes; perfusion.
A district with a government that typically encloses no other governed districts; a borough, city, or incorporated town or village.
The governing body of such a district.
The flesh between the last rib and the hip; the side.
A cut of meat from the flank of an animal.
The extreme left or right edge of a military formation, army etc.
The sides of a bastion perpendicular to the wall from which the bastion projects.
The side of something, in general senses.
The outermost strip of a road.
The wing, one side of the pitch.
That part of the acting surface of a gear wheel tooth that lies within the pitch line.
To attack the flank(s) of.
To defend the flank(s) of.
To place to the side(s) of.
To be placed to the side(s) of something (usually in terms of two objects, one on each side).

(of speed) Maximum. Historically faster than full speed (the most a vessel can sustain without excessive engine wear or risk of damage), now frequently used interchangeably. Typically used in an emergency or during an attack.
definitions.example: All ahead flank!

definitions.definition: (often used with the, sometimes capitalized: the Plague) The bubonic plague, the pestilent disease caused by the virulent bacterium Yersinia pestis.
An epidemic or pandemic caused by any pestilence, but specifically by the above disease.
A widespread affliction, calamity or destructive influx, especially when seen as divine retribution.
definitions.example: Ten Biblical plagues over Egypt, ranging from locusts to the death of the crown prince, finally forced Pharaoh to let Moses's people go.

definitions.definition: A grave nuisance, whatever greatly irritates.
definitions.example: Bart is an utter plague; his pranks never cease.

definitions.definition: Collective noun for common grackles
To harass, pester or annoy someone persistently or incessantly.
To afflict with a disease or other calamity.
definitions.example: Natural catastrophes plagued the colonists till they abandoned the pestilent marshland.

definitions.definition: A sterol lipid synthesized by the liver and transported in the bloodstream to the membranes of all animal cells; it plays a central role in many biochemical processes and, as a lipoprotein that coats the walls of blood vessels, is associated with cardiovascular disease.
The level of cholesterol in the body.
definitions.example: improve your cholesterol; lower your cholesterol

definitions.definition: Of a language: such that syllables may last different amounts of time, but there is perceived to be a fairly constant amount of time between consecutive stressed syllables.
A type of soup that contains noodles in the shape of various alphabetical letters.
An overabundance of acronyms and abbreviations.
A boast or boasting; bragging; ostentatious pretence or self-glorification.
The thing which is boasted of.
(by ellipsis) The card game three card brag.
To boast; to talk with excessive pride about what one has, is able to do, or has done; often as an attempt to popularize oneself.
definitions.example: to brag of one's exploits, courage, or money

definitions.definition: To boast of.
Excellent; first-rate.
Brisk; full of spirits; boasting; pretentious; conceited.
definitions.example: a woundy, brag young fellow

definitions.definition: Proudly; boastfully
Tibetan Buddhism.
Imposing obligation, legally, morally, or otherwise; binding; mandatory.
definitions.example: an obligatory promise

definitions.definition: Requiring a matter or obligation.
Money invested in an innovative enterprise in which both the potential for profit and the risk of loss are considerable.
An automobile with a retractable top.
A light two- or four-wheeled carriage with a folding top, pulled by a single horse.
Fairness in society.
A waterspout
A large waterfall; steep rapids in a river.
definitions.example: The cataracts on the Nile helped to compartment Upper Egypt.

definitions.definition: A flood of water
An overwhelming downpour or rush
definitions.example: His cataract of eloquence

definitions.definition: A clouding of the lens in the eye leading to a decrease in vision.
To mention.
definitions.example: Don't bring up politics if you want to have a quiet conversation with that guy.

definitions.definition: To raise (children).
definitions.example: She did well enough bringing up two sons and a daughter on her own.

definitions.definition: To uncover, to bring from obscurity; to resurface (e.g. a memory)
definitions.example: A short Internet search brought up some amazing details of this story.

definitions.definition: To turn on power or start, as of a machine.
definitions.example: Wait a minute while I bring up my computer.

definitions.definition: To vomit.
definitions.example: I was very ill today; I kept bringing up everything I ate.

definitions.definition: To stop or interrupt a flow or steady motion.
To throw a pitch at a much slower than expected speed.
definitions.example: He changed up on Wilson after three fastballs and struck him out.

definitions.definition: To confuse someone by doing something unexpected or in an unexpected way.
definitions.example: I thought that we were going to study the project some more, but then he came back from the weekend and changed up, making it a top priority.

definitions.definition: To change to a higher gear in a vehicle
(law enforcement) A police patrol car.
(by extension) The police, a police officer or the clothing they wear.
A type of giant cookie (about 8 inches diameter) with icing on the top side: half white, half dark chocolate.
Easily divided into diametrically opposing camps or schools of thought.
Of art, a photograph or photography, using shades of grey/gray rather than colour/color.
Of a television or monitor, displaying images in shades of grey/gray rather than colour/color.
Classifying people, objects or concepts as two polar opposites, especially "right" and "wrong"; dichotomous and inflexible.
To render larger, more extended, or more intense.
definitions.example: amplify a microscopes

definitions.definition: To enlarge by addition or commenting; to treat copiously by adding particulars, illustrations, etc.; to expand.
To increase the amplitude of something, especially of an electric current.
definitions.example: amplify a signal

definitions.definition: To add content that is not present in the source text to the target text, usually to improve the fluency of the translation.
To dismiss (someone, especially military personnel) from service
To discard, put away
To annul
One who works at a till or receives payments.
Person in charge of the cash of a business or bank.
A work of art, drama, literature, music, or architecture that imitates the work of a previous artist.
A musical medley, typically quoting other works.
An incongruous mixture; a hodgepodge.
definitions.example: The house failed to attract a buyer because the decor was a pastiche of Bohemian and Scandinavian styles.

definitions.definition: A postmodern playwriting technique that fuses a variety of styles, genres, and story lines to create a new form.
To create or compose in a mixture of styles.
Someone who spends money improvidently or wastefully.
Improvident, profligate, or wasteful.
Extravagant or lavish.
The lower orifice of the alimentary canal, through which feces and flatus are ejected.
A unit of measure, consisting of 10 of some object, particularly hides and skins.
A chaffering, barter, or exchange, of small wares.
definitions.example: to make a dicker

definitions.definition: To bargain, haggle or negotiate over a sale.
To barter.
To make distinctions.
(construed with against) To make decisions based on prejudice.
definitions.example: The law prohibits discriminating against people based on their skin color.

definitions.definition: To set apart as being different; to mark as different; to separate from another by discerning differences; to distinguish.
Having the difference marked; distinguished by certain tokens.
A kind of narrative poem, adapted for recitation or singing; especially, a sentimental or romantic poem in short stanzas.
definitions.example: The poet composed a ballad praising the heroic exploits of the fallen commander.

definitions.definition: A slow romantic song.
definitions.example: On Friday nights, the roller rink had a time-block called "Lovers' Lap" when they played nothing but ballads on the overhead speakers.

definitions.definition: To make mention of in ballads.
To compose or sing ballads.
The part of a restaurant, theatre, business, etc. presented to the public.
A period of fifty years, half of a century.
A score of 50 runs by a single batsman
A score of 50 points in a single game.
A crime committed by having unorthodox, unofficial, controversial or socially unacceptable thoughts.
A work of art.
The complete body of an artist's work.
